title: MAN HELD AFTER SEPT. 11 DEPORTED TO PAKISTAN
body:
Ansar Mahmood, 27, a Pakistani immigrant detained on terror suspicions in fall 2001 after he photographed near a 
water-treatment plant near Hudson, N.Y., has been deported, officials confirmed Friday.

Mahmood was cleared of any ties to terrorism, but investigators found he helped a Pakistani couple with expired 
visas obtain housing and charged him with harboring illegal immigrants, officials said.

Notes

National News in Brief
